conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine motion characteristics.
The graph shows velocity on the y-axis and time on the x-axis. Velocity increases from 0 to 1 second, peaks at 1 second, then decreases from 1 to 3 seconds.
From 0 to 1 second, velocity increases linearly, indicating constant acceleration.
From 1 to 3 seconds, velocity decreases, indicating deceleration.
Need to examine the behavior of velocity between 1 and 2 seconds.
The graph shows a curve from 1 to 2 seconds, indicating velocity is decreasing but not linearly.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
The slope of the v-t graph represents acceleration.
From 1 to 2 seconds, the slope of the graph is decreasing, meaning acceleration is decreasing.
The particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
